1 These include permanent and fixed term, excludes casual/temporary employees and contingent workers not directly employed by QBE. Calculation excludes employees with gender noted as 'Unspecified': 2022 = 6; 2023 = 11

2 Total number of full-time equivalent (FTE) workforce in 2023 = 13,918. From 2021, QBE has updated this definition of FTE to include casual/temporary employees as well as contractors not employed directly by QBE, as these form part of our complete workforce.
3 Group Head Office employees are based across all divisions of operation.
4 Group Shared Services Centre employees are based in the Philippines.

5 Employee level is determined by role, responsibilities and level of experience required and is maintained in our HR system Workday. Employment Level is a classification scale of all job roles, using a 0 through 6 scale, whereby Level 0 encompasses the most \n senior leadership roles (i.e., GEC), and Level 6 encompasses the most junior entry-level roles.

6 This includes permanent employees, excludes fixed term and casual/temporary employees as well as contingent workers not directly employed by QBE. Leavers are counted on the first day that they are not working at QBE. Gender attrition rates calculation

(# terminated employees divided by Average Headcount) excludes employees with gender noted as 'Unspecified' at the time of termination: From the numerator: 2022 = 3; 2023 = 0; from the denominator: 2022 = 6; 2023 = 11
7 Overall leavers include both voluntary and involuntary figures.
8 Voluntary leavers typically comprise resignations, completion of fixed term engagements or voluntary retirement.
9 Involuntary leavers principally include those terminated through dismissal or redundancy.
10 The total excludes employees with gender noted as 'Unspecified' at the time of termination: From the numerator: 2022 = 3; 2023 = 0; from the denominator: 2022 = 6; 2023 = 11
